title: MIA Mid-Experiment Survey #1
description: This is the first weekly survey to gauge your progress during the experiment.

sections.title: Basic Information
sections.description: This section is simply for us to identify who is filling out the survey.

questions.label: Name
questions.question: What is your name?

questions.label: Email
questions.question: What is your email?

questions.label: Age
questions.question: How old are you?

questions.label: Recognition RTK
questions.question: Have you completed RRTK (Recognition RTK, previously known as Lazy Kanji)?
questions.note: We forgot to ask this question in the initial survey

questions.label: Production RTK
questions.question: Have you completed PRTK (Production RTK, previously known as Traditional RTK)?
questions.note: We forgot to ask this question in the initial survey

questions.label: Kanji Studies Outside of RTK
questions.question: Please describe your Kanji studies outside of RTK (e.x WaniKani, KanjiDamage, Kanji From Zero, etc). You may leave this blank if this does not apply to you
questions.note: We forgot to ask this question in the initial survey

sections.title: Immersion Stats
sections.description: This section will help us understand how you study Japanese. Don't feel bad if your answer to any of these questions is zero XD

questions.label: Average Hours of Active Listening
questions.question: How many hours of active listening did you do this week?

questions.label: Average Hours of Passive Listening
questions.question: How many hours of passive listening did you do this week?

questions.label: Average Hours of Reading
questions.question: How many hours of reading did you do this week?

questions.label: Percentage of Active Listening with subtitles
questions.question: What percentage of your active listening happened with subtitles (including the time spent mining sentences from subtitles)?

questions.label: Days of Active Immersion Missed
questions.question: How many days of active immersion did you miss this week? (NOTE: If you immersed a bit less than your average immersion time, you can still count that as a day of immersion.)

questions.label: Days of Reading Missed
questions.question: How many days of reading did you miss this week?

sections.title: Card Types
sections.description: This section is for us to understand your feelings about the card types we are testing.

questions.label: Difficulty to Learn New Cards
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how difficult do you feel it is to learn new cards with this note type? (1 = extremely easy, 5 = extremely difficult)

questions.label: Difficulty to Remember Learned Cards
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how difficult do you feel it is to remember learned cards with this note type (cards you have reviewed at least once)? (1 = extremely easy, 5 = extremely difficult)

questions.label: How Enjoyable is Reviewing
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how enjoyable do you feel it is to review cards with this note type? (1 = horrible to review, 5 = extremely enjoyable to review)

questions.label: Card Leads to Understanding In Immersion
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how well do you feel cards with this note type lead to improved understanding in immersion? (1 = I almost never notice/understand words I learned with this note type in my immersion, 5 = I very frequently notice/understand words I learned with this note type in my immersion)

questions.label: Difficulty to Learn New Cards
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how difficult do you feel it is to learn new cards with this note type? (1 = extremely easy, 5 = extremely difficult)

questions.label: Difficulty to Remember Learned Cards
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how difficult do you feel it is to remember learned cards with this note type (cards you have reviewed at least once)? (1 = extremely easy, 5 = extremely difficult)

questions.label: How Enjoyable is Reviewing
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how enjoyable do you feel it is to review cards with this note type? (1 = horrible to review, 5 = extremely enjoyable to review)

questions.label: Card Leads to Understanding In Immersion
questions.question: On a scale of 1-5, how well do you feel cards with this note type lead to improved understanding in immersion? (1 = I almost never notice/understand words I learned with this note type in my immersion, 5 = I very frequently notice/understand words I learned with this note type in my immersion)

questions.label: Preferred Card Type
questions.question: Which of the card types do you prefer to review in Anki?
